channel.title: Northern Leadership Podcast
channel.description:
The Northern Leadership Academy has been set up by three business schools to develop the leadership skills in business in the north of England.
The monthly podcast provides an overview of the opportunities, events, and resources available through the academy - as well as interviews with acclaimed business leaders who are great role models.
For more information on the Northern Leadership Academy, visit www.northernleadershipacademy.co.uk.
The podcast is produced by Red Studios: www.redstudios.co.uk
channel.itunes:subtitle: Ideas and resources for business leaders in northern England
channel.itunes:summary: The Northern Leadership Academy has been set up by three business schools to develop the leadership skills in business in the north of England. The monthly podcast provides an overview of the opportunities, events, and resources available through the academy - as well as interviews with acclaimed business leaders who are great role models. For more information on the Northern Leadership Academy, visit www.northernleadershipacademy.co.uk. The podcast is produced by Red Studios: www.redstudios.co.uk
channel.itunes:keywords: business, entrepreneur, entrepreneurs, leader, leadership, management, podexec

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 10
item.description: This month we hear from leadership consultant Phil Dourado, business forecaster Professor Richard Scase and Professor Jimmy Hill from the University of Liverpool Management School.
item.itunes:author: Northern Leadership Academy
item.itunes:summary:
The tenth episode of the NLA podcast in which we look at some of the new information and resources on the Northern Leadership Academy website and future opportunities. This month we hear from leadership consultant Phil Dourado, business forecaster Professor Richard Scase and Professor Jimmy Hill from the University of Liverpool Management School.
Produced by Red Studios, www.redstudios.co.uk
item.dc:creator: heather.schofield

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 09
item.description: This month we hear from Jane Farrelly, Managing Director of Hope Street Hotel, and motivational guru Steve McDermott.

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 08
item.description: This month we hear from Alex Kitchen, Managing Director at Velden Engineering, and Lis Smith, Director of Skills Policy at the Northwest Regional Development Agency, as well as remembering Sir John Harvey-Jones who passed away in Janauary.
item.itunes:author: Northern Leadership Academy
item.itunes:summary:
The eighth episode of the NLA podcast in which we look at some of the new information and resources on the Northern Leadership Academy website and future opportunities. On this episode we also hear from Alex Kitchen, Managing Director at Velden Engineering, and Lis Smith, Director of Skills Policy at the Northwest Regional Development Agency, as well as remembering Sir John Harvey-Jones who passed away in January.
Produced by Red Studios, www.redstudios.co.uk
item.dc:creator: heather.schofield

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 06
item.description: This month we hear from Andrew Lewis, Director of the Northern Way, and Sir John Harvey-Jones (MBE), who first came to fame as Chairman of ICI.

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 05
item.description:
On this episode we hear from Deidre Bounds, founder of ethical travel company i-to-i, and Clive Lewis from the Institute of Chartered Accountants - and we hear the story of entrepreneur Tim Smit, who founded the Eden Project.

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 04
item.description: On this episode we find out about MBA's - and we hear the story of entrepreneur Luke Johnson, who's just bought the UK division of Borders and is the current chairman of Channel 4.

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 03
item.description: On this episode we find out about staff motivation from the Managing Director at Beaverbrooks the Jewellers - and we hear the story of entrepreneur John Barnes, who made his name as a branding guru after building Harry Ramsden’s into an international name.
item.itunes:author: Northern Leadership Academy
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 02
item.description: On this episode we find out about Knowledge Transfer Partnerships, helping companies to tap into the brainpower of universities for research and development - and we hear the story of northern entrepreneur Wayne Hemingway, who founded fashion label Red Or Dead and is now taking on the UK housebuilding sector.
item.itunes:summary:
The second episode of the NLA podcast in which we look at some of the new information and resources on the Northern Leadership Academy website and upcoming events. On this episode we also find out about Knowledge Transfer Partnerships, helping companies to tap into the brainpower of universities for research and development - and we hear the story of northern entrepreneur Wayne Hemingway, who founded fashion label Red Or Dead and is now taking on the UK housebuilding sector.
Produced by Red Studios, www.redstudios.co.uk

item.title: Northern Leadership Podcast 01
item.description: Includes recordings of key NLA events, a special report on what leaders need to know about the opportunities and threats from China, and an interview with Simon Woodroffe, founder of Yo!Sushi.
item.itunes:author: Northern Leadership Academy
item.itunes:summary:
The first episode of the new podcast from the Northern Leadership Academy.
Includes recordings of key NLA events, a special report on what leaders need to know about the opportunities and threats from China, and an interview with Simon Woodroffe, founder of Yo!Sushi.
The podcast is produced by Red Studios. www.redstudios.co.uk
item.dc:creator: administrator
